H0.text: Electricity is the force that causes a student’s thrown ball to slow while it travels upward, as the ball’s speed decreases during its ascent.

H1.text: Gravity is the force that causes the ball to slow while traveling up when a student throws it into the air, decreasing its speed as it rises.

H2.text: Magnetism is the force that causes a ball thrown by a student to slow while it travels upward, as the ball’s speed decreases during its ascent.

H3.text: Tension is the force that causes the ball to slow while traveling up as a student throws it into the air.

A6.text: Near the surface of the Earth, an object in free fall in a vacuum will accelerate at approximately 9.8 m/s², independent of its mass.
